Visit[BM Admin](https://benningtonmuseum.org/author/s2benmuseum/ "Posts by BM Admin")2025-09-29T10:03:47-04:00

# 

VISIT

#### 

Planning a visit to Bennington Museum?  
Let us connect you to the culture of this region!

Explore [fourteen galleries](https://benningtonmuseum.org/whats-on-view/), a [research library](https://benningtonmuseum.org/visit/regional-history-room/), and a [10-acre park ](https://benningtonmuseum.org/visit/walking-trail/)with changing sculptures.

**LOCATION & CONTACT  
**75 Main Street  
Bennington, VT 05201  
Phone: [802-447-1571](tel:802-447-1571)  
[info@benningtonmuseum.org](mailto:info@benningtonmuseum.org)

**HOURS:  
**10am-4pm  
Everyday except Wednesdays  
Closed: Jan-March

_Open until 7pm on Fridays,_  
_June 2 – September 8_

**ADMISSION  
**Adults – $16  
Seniors (62+) and Students 18 and over – $14  
Youth aged 17 and under – Free

[Museum Members](https://benningtonmuseum.org/join-give/become-a-member/), [NARM](https://narmassociation.org/) card holders, and [Families with SNAP card benefits](https://museums4all.org/): Free  
[Active Duty Military](https://www.arts.gov/initiatives/blue-star-museums): Free from Armed Forces Day to Labor Day  
[Group Rates](https://benningtonmuseum.org/visit/groups-and-tours/) are available!

Except for licensed service dogs, pets are not allowed in the Museum.  
Leashed dogs are welcome on the trail and grounds.

You should allow approximately 1 to 3 hours for your visit.

#### NEARBY FOOD & LODGING

accessibility_text:
Directions, Parking & Accessibility[BM Admin](https://benningtonmuseum.org/author/s2benmuseum/ "Posts by BM Admin")2023-04-19T07:22:56-04:00

## Directions

Bennington Museum  
75 Main Street  
Bennington Vermont, 05201

Contact us at 802-447-1571 or via email at [info@benningtonmuseum.org](mailto:info@benningtonmuseum.org)

### Easy Cultural Access

Bennington Museum welcomes all visitors and affirms its commitment to making the collections and programs accessible to everyone. The museum is wheelchair accessible. A wheelchair is available free of charge on a first-come, first-served basis at the Visitors’ Services Desk. Service animals are welcome. All restrooms have accessible stalls and an elevator provides access to the second floor galleries. Reserved wheelchair accessible parking is designated closest to the entrance.

**For Visitors Who Are Deaf or Hard of Hearing**  
American Sign Language interpretation for public programs is available by request, free of charge with admission to the program. Advance notice is required and requests should be made at least one month in advance of your visit. Call [802-447-1571](tel:802-447-1571). For relay call 711. Or email [education@benningtonmuseum.org](mailto:education@benningtonmuseum.org).

**For Visitors Who are Blind or Have Low Vision**  
Verbal description tours are available at no additional cost for visitors who are blind or have low vision. These tours provide an opportunity to experience the richness and diversity of th...
